definition:
If $ABC$ is a triangle and $AD, DE, CF$ are its three , then the
triangle $DEF$ is called the *orthic triangle* of $ABC$.

A remarkable property of orthic triangles says that the orthocenter of
$ABC$ is also the incenter of the orthic triangle $DEF$. That is, the
heights of $ABC$ are the angle bisectors of $DEF$.
